1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience

2.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself)
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

3.brief: an extremity; adverbially (with prepositional prefix) after
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
desire (and so probably in Proverbs 31:4); hence (by way of alternative) or, also if

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, to press, i.e. (figuratively) to be pungent or vehement; to irritate
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce

4.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
a conditional particle; if; by implication (interj. as a wish) would that!
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to join (literally or figuratively); specifically (by means of spells) to fascinate
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
to waver, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (as subjoined)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

5.brief: to be alert, physically (on foot) or mentally (in courage)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
to restrain or (reflex.) refrain; by implication, to refuse, spare, preserve; to observe

6.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to restrain or (reflex.) refrain; by implication, to refuse, spare, preserve; to observe
properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)

7.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to tire; (figuratively) to be (or make) disgusted
to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a stated assemblage (specifically, a concourse, or generally, a family or crowd)

8.brief: concretely, a witness; abstractly, testimony; specifically, a recorder, i.e. prince
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
literally a failure of flesh, i.e. emaciation; figuratively, hypocrisy
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce

9.brief: properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to pluck off or pull to pieces; causatively to supply with food (as in morsels)
properly, to lurk for, i.e. persecute
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
properly, to hammer out (an edge), i.e. to sharpen
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

10.brief: to yawn, i.e. open wide (literally or figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
the cheek (from its fleshiness); hence, the jaw-bone
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)

11.brief: to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
near, with or among; often in general, to
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to precipitate or hurl (rush) headlong; (intransitively) to be rash

12.brief: tranquil; (in a bad sense) careless; abstractly, security
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to break up (usually figuratively), i.e. to violate, frustrate
to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
the nape or back of the neck (as declining); hence, the back generally (whether literal or figurative)
to dash in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to disperse)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
a jail (as a guard-house); also an aim (as being closely watched)

13.brief: to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to slice, i.e. break open or pierce
a kidney (as an essential organ); figuratively, the mind (as the interior self)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to commiserate; by implication, to spare
to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

14.brief: to break out (in many applications, direct and indirect, literal and figurative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to run (for whatever reason, especially to rush)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

15.brief: properly, a mesh (as allowing a liquid to run through), i.e. coarse loose cloth or sacking (used in mourning and for bagging); hence, a bag (for grain, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to effect thoroughly; specifically, to glean (also figuratively); by implication (in a bad sense) to overdo, i.e. maltreat, be saucy to, pain, impose (also literal)
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
a horn (as projecting); by implication, a flask, cornet; by resemblance. an elephant's tooth (i.e. ivory), a corner (of the altar), a peak (of a mountain), a ray (of light); figuratively, power

16.brief: the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to boil up; hence, to ferment (with scum); to glow (with redness); to smear with pitch
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
a weeping; by analogy, a dripping
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
an eyelash (as fluttering); figuratively, morning ray
shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity)

17.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn

18.brief: the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

19.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
concretely, a witness; abstractly, testimony; specifically, a recorder, i.e. prince
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)

20.brief: properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede
near, with or among; often in general, to
to drip; by implication, to weep
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

21.brief: to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

22.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a year (as a revolution of time)
a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration
a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
